results.title: How Not To Be Seen
results.brief_description: A satirical take on instructional films, How Not to Be Seen features a mix of actual and virtual performers and scenes, which illustrate the strategies for becoming invisible, communicated in an authoritative narrative voiceover. - MoMA
results.description: A satirical take on instructional films, How Not to Be Seen features a mix of actual and virtual performers and scenes, which illustrate the strategies for becoming invisible, communicated in an authoritative narrative voiceover. - MoMA
description_for_label: A satirical take on instructional films, How Not to Be Seen features a mix of actual and virtual performers and scenes, which illustrate the strategies for becoming invisible, communicated in an authoritative narrative voiceover. - MoMA

results.title: How Not To Be Seen
results.brief_description: “How Not to Be Seen” is a popular sketch from Monty Python’s Flying Circus. It first aired as the 11th episode of the second series of the show in 1970. The sketch purports to be a British public service film.
results.description: “How Not to Be Seen” is a popular sketch from Monty Python’s Flying Circus. It was first aired as the 11th episode of the second series of the show on 8 December 1970. This filmed sketch purports to be a British government film presented for public service.
description_for_label: “How Not to Be Seen” is a popular sketch from Monty Python’s Flying Circus. It was first aired as the 11th episode of the second series of the show on 8 December 1970. This filmed sketch purports to be a British government film presented for public service.

results.title: How much you mean to me nan
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Chris Mansfield
results.brief_description: She is always there when things get rough, she is the backbone of our mob, she is my nan…and I will love her always. A dedication by Chris to his nan.

results.title: How much is enough
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the work of the United Nations Children’s Fund in Africa, the Near East, Pakistan, the Orient and the West Indies. It shows the scope and the type of work done by the organisation which raises money all over the world to help needy children in underdeveloped areas

results.title: How much does the earth weigh?: measurement and mass
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how to calculate the size and composition of the earth, explaining the difference between weight and mass using a spring scale and a balance scale. Also covers the scientific ideas of displacement, volume and density.

results.title: How much cooperation?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
A discussion-provoking film about employer and employee office cooperation. A supervisor returns from an out of town trip with a rush job. He speaks to the staff about it and promises to have it ready so they won’t have to work back on it.

results.title: How much affection?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
A social guidance docu-drama promoting restraint against premarital sex. After nearly succumbing to her boyfriend’s advances, teenager Laurie seeks her mother’s advice. Following a sensible discussion with her mother and the lesson provided by her friend Eileen, a victim of her physical urges, Laurie considers the long term consequences of sexual temptation.
